items.title: As Iran’s Government Tries to Quell Protests, Accounts of Brutal Crackdown Emerge
items.author: Erika Solomon, Farnaz Fassihi, Sanam Mahoozi and Sanjana Varghese
items.description: As many as 3,000 feared dead as witnesses describe government forces firing on unarmed protesters.
items.content: As many as 3,000 feared dead as witnesses describe government forces firing on unarmed protesters.
categories: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

items.title: At This Office Park, Scamming the World Was the Business
items.author: Hannah Beech and Jes Aznar
items.description: Times journalists got a rare look inside one of the compounds where the online fraud industry makes its billions. Inspirational slogans (“Keep going”) were just the start.
items.content: Times journalists got a rare look inside one of the compounds where the online fraud industry makes its billions. Inspirational slogans (“Keep going”) were just the start.

items.title: Greenland Would Be the Largest U.S. Land Acquisition, if Trump Got His Way
items.author: Jeffrey Gettleman
items.description: Denmark does not want to sell its territory. But for a real estate mogul turned president, the world’s largest island may be irresistible.
items.content: Denmark does not want to sell its territory. But for a real estate mogul turned president, the world’s largest island may be irresistible.

items.title: Marine Le Pen Is Appealing a Decision to Bar Her From Office.
items.author: Ségolène Le Stradic and Catherine Porter
items.description: Ms. Le Pen, whose far-right party leads polls in France, was convicted last year of embezzlement. The outcome of her appeal, which started on Tuesday, will determine if she can run for president next year.
items.content: Ms. Le Pen, whose far-right party leads polls in France, was convicted last year of embezzlement. The outcome of her appeal, which started on Tuesday, will determine if she can run for president next year.

items.title: Trump Urges Antigovernment Protesters in Iran to ‘Take Over’
items.author: Abdi Latif Dahir and Leily Nikounazar
items.description: “HELP IS ON ITS WAY,” President Trump said on social media. He has threatened to intervene militarily on behalf of the protesters if Iran uses lethal force.
items.content: “HELP IS ON ITS WAY,” President Trump said on social media. He has threatened to intervene militarily on behalf of the protesters if Iran uses lethal force.
categories: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

items.title: Uganda Cuts Internet Days Before Presidential Election
items.author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg and Musinguzi Blanshe
items.description: The authorities say the decision was made to prevent the spread of misinformation as President Yoweri Museveni seeks his seventh term in office.
items.content: The authorities say the decision was made to prevent the spread of misinformation as President Yoweri Museveni seeks his seventh term in office.

items.title: Trump Says London Is Unsafe. Its Murder Rate Just Hit a Historic Low.
items.author: Lizzie Dearden and Michael D. Shear
items.description: The city’s homicide rate is lower than that of New York, Paris or Toronto, contradicting a narrative promoted by President Trump and others on the populist right.
items.content: The city’s homicide rate is lower than that of New York, Paris or Toronto, contradicting a narrative promoted by President Trump and others on the populist right.

items.title: How a Syrian Hiking Club Is Rediscovering the Country
items.author: Raja Abdulrahim and Diego Ibarra Sanchez
items.description: The nearly 14-year civil war prevented Syrians from traveling freely to many parts of their own country. After the conflict ended a year ago, a group of outdoor enthusiasts began exploring newly accessible areas, fueled by a sense of adventure and hope.
items.content: The nearly 14-year civil war prevented Syrians from traveling freely to many parts of their own country. After the conflict ended a year ago, a group of outdoor enthusiasts began exploring newly accessible areas, fueled by a sense of adventure and hope.

items.title: Spanish Singer Julio Iglesias Accused of Sexual Assault
items.author: Jason Horowitz
items.description: Prosecutors said two former employees of Mr. Iglesias, a renowned Spanish singer, had accused him of abuse. His representatives did not respond to requests for comment.
items.content: Prosecutors said two former employees of Mr. Iglesias, a renowned Spanish singer, had accused him of abuse. His representatives did not respond to requests for comment.

items.title: China’s ‘Dr. Frankenstein’ Thinks Time Is on His Side
items.author: Andrew Higgins
items.description: He Jiankui spent three years in prison after creating gene-edited babies. Now back at work, he sees a greater opening for researchers who push boundaries.
items.content: He Jiankui spent three years in prison after creating gene-edited babies. Now back at work, he sees a greater opening for researchers who push boundaries.
